title: Which support do you think is the best out of these?
body:
Brand, Lux ,annie, Velkoz, Malzahar and Syndra.

I want to main a fkn burst mage that can take it's own stand in the game. If lets say I get a bad adc then i can carry the adc instead :D So it's a win win situation for me!

No one can beat lux's utility but she lacks the burst that other supp here have maybe on par with malzahar but malz has great CC. I have played some matches as velkoz and he is simply great for poking and even bursting without even having insane mana issues like lux has early game. I am thinking maybe brand is the way to go as he can carry hard! Or am i wrong? 

Which supp/mage  you think is the easiest to carry with ? Also give reasons if possible, it would be appreciated. Thanks.

That's completely related, as it affects how good they are.

I suppose it is, but that's almost a 180 question. OP is interested which mage is best to carry and I'm more curious which one can actually be relevant when playing even or losing lane. I want to say it would be Lux out of that list, but my experience would only be comparing her to Annie. I have no idea how useful the other mages are when supporting.

Smh...  Converted "support" players that want to carry. To answer your question, the best on that list is whichever one allows you to best support your ADC. 

For all that is holy at least buy a sightstone!

Every one of these choices is awful except for Malzahar.  None of them are actually "Support" characters, which also includes Zyra, if you want to be technical.

The easiest true Support to carry with is any melee Tanker with hard engage like Alistar, since most teams don't end up with a tank at all.
The best carry out of those you listed is Brand.
The best "support" out of what you listed is Malzahar.

Hey there, I'm a high gold / low plat support main and have been playing the game for quite awhile. Support mages are viable so long as you have the ability to cover your adc and stop your enemy from engaging on them. CC is really important for this spot, but raw burst can work too. 

If your relying on damage/mage style comps - I highly recommend looking at your opponents MR score. Poke who will suffer the most damage. These comps have trouble against healing/shielding and strong initiate setups. 

Always buy a warding item, no matter your champion and know the matchups to have a chance. 

**If your looking to 'carry' in the support role, the EASIEST and BEST way to do that is by empowering and protecting your ADC. Always try that first. If you think your ADC is awful, then yea, play safe and turn into a secondary mage. Remember that you will deal less damage and be weaker than mid/top lane until late game. sneak farm where you can get it and roam into mid-lane for ganks, like a jungler.**

 I'll go through your choices with you: 

{{champion:63}} 
Brand is pretty solid in the support role right now - he deals a very large sum of damage through the mid game without needing many items to back him up. Brand's stun is hard to trigger on demand, he suffers against long-range poke and strong initiate. You protect your ADC by making them scared to approach you or your adc, fear of damage is what wins with brand. He's even scarier post-6. 

{{champion:99}} {{champion:161}} {{champion:101}} {{champion:115}} 
All 4 of these can be played in the support role and generally perform the same function - poke the bajeezus out of the enemy ADC and make it really hard for them to farm. Win the lane on poke and make it hard for them the enemy bot lane to initiate/farm. Ganks can really hurt these guys. This is why they don't see much play past plat/diamond (Except Ziggs, because he needs a nerf!) 

{{champion:1}} Been a support staple since the beginning. You player basically like brand, except you can rely on her stun to stop enemies from engaging. No one approaches Annie when she has her stun. This is controlling the lane through fear. 

{{champion:90}} It's in meta right now, and thats because his shield and poke are pretty great - You want to play him like an offensive-themed Sona. Float around, throw crap out into the lane to damage enemies, and abuse your ult for kills/saves.

{{champion:134}} She does have some solid CC and respectable poke, but you have to mess with the ADCS farm to do it - Also, she needs items to become terrifying. Brand and Annie can work through the midgame on budget items - Not her. I think this is why you dont see her in the support role.
I really liked your message and i appreciate you spend your precious time to write all this down. It will help a lot in the long run. Thanks.

Just so things don't get complicated. I know these are burst mages instead of supports but i want to play them as supports. As i have already tried velkoz and it works fine and also why they are kinda meta now if you ask me. I just want to have a change plus i won't play them in ranked until i know they will work or atleast i get good at them. 

Also sightstone is a must item for a support eventhough everyone should ward but i will get sightstone regardless of that. I have supported my adc's enough with soraka, i want to be able to supp my adc as well for a change or atleast get more than 1 kill a game :D

Also you may not believe but sometimes passive supports do not work against other burst mage supports at all. The adc will get rekt and you just won't be able to sheild/heal him enough. Maybe if i went tank support with CC that might work out but i hate using tanks for some reason.

Zyra, Malzahar, and Brand become your best choices.

Zyra is the standard right now.  People really don't know how to deal with her range.  Countered By:  Alistar, Miss Fortune, Sion, Nasus, Morgana. (Note: There is a nerf patch on PBE that, if it goes through, will send her into the dumpster.)

Malzahar is the flavor of the month, but his usefulness is obvious.  He would be my choice given the current situation.  Countered By:  Lulu, Zyra, Miss Fortune, Zilean

Brand is used as Support mainly for his oft-difficult to use stun.  Once you master zoning and using his stun, he becomes strong in the role.  Brand is a killer in later team fights, as his ultimate is brutal.  Countered By: Tanks, Zyra, Soraka, possibly even a good Sona

Vel, Brand and Malz are the best choices from that list.  Annie is okay? Lux and Syndra need AP to be useful.

With brand/malz/vel you can do decent damage while warding and taking FQC.

{{champion:99}} , just make sure you land your passive auto every time your spelthieds edge is at 3 charges, you can go with the mana regen with athenes and ardent and then into zzrot for the "ur not taking this tower" build if your adc knows how to farm at least.  Or you can just go full ap midlane build and delete from 1000 range
